related_questions.question: How do you get a job with the UN?
related_questions.snippet: All job openings in the UN Secretariat are published on the United Nations Careers Portal. When you apply for a job, you have to submit an application in the UN online recruitment system. For information on how to apply for a job using the new online recruitment system, inspira, go to Application Process.
related_questions.title: Creating your job application - UN Careers - the United Nations

related_questions.question: What is the work of UNDP?
related_questions.snippet: UNDP works in about 170 countries and territories, helping to achieve the eradication of poverty, and the reduction of inequalities and exclusion. We help countries to develop policies, leadership skills, partnering abilities, institutional capabilities and build resilience in order to sustain development results.
related_questions.title: About us | UNDP

related_questions.question: Do UN interns get paid?
related_questions.snippet: Once selected, you must begin your internship either prior to or within one year of graduation. Cost: United Nations interns are not paid. All costs related to travel, insurance, accommodation, and living expenses must be borne by either the interns or their sponsoring institutions.
related_questions.title: Internship programme - UN Careers - the United Nations

related_questions.question: Is the UNDP a NGO?
related_questions.snippet: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is the United Nations' global development network. ... The UNDP is funded entirely by voluntary contributions from UN member states. The organization operates in 177 countries, where it works with local governments to meet development challenges and develop local capacity.
related_questions.title: United Nations Development Programme - Wikipedia
